Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday April 16), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, april 16th. microsoft is reportedly in talks to acquire discord for more than $10 billion. the potential deal would bring the popular communication platform under microsoft's wing, enhancing its gaming offerings and community reach. discord has gained significant traction with gamers and content creators, with over 140 million active users worldwide. this acquisition aligns with microsoft's strategy to bolster its presence in the social and gaming ecosystem.

meanwhile, amazon is scaling up its logistics network by introducing autonomous delivery drones in select u.s. cities. this move aims to improve delivery efficiency and speed in urban areas, as the company continues to tackle last-mile delivery challenges. amazon's prime air fleet has been in development for years, and the expansion marks a significant step towards integrating drone technology into everyday operations.

in the semiconductor space, intel has announced its ambitious plan to build two new manufacturing facilities in arizona. the $20 billion investment signals intel's commitment to boosting domestic chip production to address the global semiconductor shortage. these new fabs are expected to strengthen intel's manufacturing capabilities and support the increased demand for chips across various sectors.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
"i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, april 16th. microsoft is reportedly in talks to acquire discord for more than $10 billion. this potential deal would bring the popular communication platform under microsoft's umbrella, enhancing its gaming capabilities and expanding its community reach. with over 140 million active users, discord has become a favorite among gamers and content creators—a move aligning with microsoft's strategy to strengthen its presence in the social and gaming ecosystem.

meanwhile, amazon is making strides in logistics by introducing autonomous delivery drones in select u.s. cities. the initiative aims to boost delivery efficiency and speed in urban areas, as the company continues to address last-mile delivery challenges. amazon's prime air fleet has been in development for years, and this expansion marks a significant step towards integrating drone technology into everyday operations.

in the semiconductor industry, intel has unveiled an ambitious $20 billion plan to construct two new manufacturing facilities in arizona. this investment underscores intel's commitment to increasing domestic chip production in response to the global semiconductor shortage. the new facilities are expected to bolster intel's manufacturing capabilities and meet the rising demand for chips across various sectors.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow."
Podcast Title: EP-258 Microsoft Eyes Discord Acquisition 🎮, Amazon's Drone Delivery Takes Off 🚁, Intel's $20b Chip Expansion 💻
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, april 16th! explore the latest in tech developments:

  • microsoft & discord acquisition talks: microsoft is in discussions to acquire discord for over $10 billion, aiming to enhance its gaming capabilities and expand its community presence with discord's 140 million active users.
  • amazon's autonomous delivery drones: amazon is launching autonomous delivery drones in select u.s. cities to improve delivery efficiency and address last-mile delivery challenges, marking a significant move for its prime air fleet.
  • intel's new manufacturing facilities: intel announces a $20 billion plan to build two new manufacturing facilities in arizona, reinforcing its commitment to domestic chip production amid the global semiconductor shortage.

join us tomorrow for more tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image featuring a futuristic cityscape at dusk, where towering skyscrapers and advanced architecture symbolize modern technology. in the foreground, an imaginative representation of a high-tech drone glides gracefully, hinting at amazon's advancements in drone delivery. the drone carries a small cargo package, its sleek design reflecting innovation. to the left, an intricate microchip partially embedded in one of the skyscrapers symbolizes intel's $20 billion chip expansion, with glowing circuitry patterns subtly extending across the structure. meanwhile, floating above and connecting the scene, holographic digital communication waves symbolize microsoft's interest in discord, merging seamlessly with the urban skyline. the elements are harmoniously intertwined, creating a unified visual narrative that highlights the tech-driven synergy of the podcast's topics
